Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different plants and animals in their habitats.
The student can draw and label the places where these plants and animals live (e.g., water, forests).
The student can represent and label the resources needed by these plants and animals (e.g., water, sunlight, air).
The student can show and label the relationships between the plants and animals and the resources they need to survive.
The student can illustrate how the habitat provides necessary resources for the animals and plants to live.
The student can demonstrate how plants and animals are part of a system where each part works together to meet their needs.
